answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Consult a gastroenterologist. You could be suffering from an inflammatory bowel condition such as Celiac Disease/Ulcerative Colitis/Irritable Bowel Syndrome/ Crohn’s disease. Other than that it could be due to H pylori infection. It can also be food intolerance. Diabetes can cause slowing of gut and can cause bloating and hence get your blood sugar tested. PCOD and hormone imbalance too could be a cause. So discuss this with your gynecologist. Take care!

question: I've had an unexplained, low grade fever for about 8 months now; no other symptoms at all except for feeling "feverish" on and off for months.  In Dec I finally decided it wasn't going away and went to the Dr.  She rattled off a handful of fatal diseases and ordered a bunch of tests.  All of the blood tests came back completely normal; CT scan showed a 4cm ovarian cyst (I guess it's only concerning when they're 5 or more) and a tumor on my liver.  Went through 5 days straight of nuclear imaging tests where they determined my liver is "just enlarged".  Then my lower back started hurting- radiating through my buttocks and left thigh; sometimes down to my foot and sometimes in both legs- what I assumed was sciatica.  It got worse over the next couple weeks; there's a swollen patch the size of a saucer over my tailbone and even my abdomen is very bloated.  Everything hurts to the touch; can't stand up straight, can't walk right, etc.  Last Fri I went back to the Dr (a new one) and she sent me to the ER for an MRI (lumbar and sacral), concerned that I had an abscess on my spine.  Negative.  In fact, nothing showed up; not even a disc or bone issue.  So I started worrying about the cyst on my ovary (I had a ruptured ovarian cyst 18 years ago so this seemed to make sense; and I'd completely skipped my last period even though I'm on the pill).  Went to an ob-gyn who gave me an ultrasound on the spot... nothing.  Not even the cyst that was there before!  And that's where I am now- still in pain, can't work, can't focus on anything else, and no answers.  Unbelievably infuriating.  Any ideas or suggestions?  Thanks
title: Low back pain and swelling; undiagnosed fever
